intro: Aglaia sibuyanensis, commonly known as Sibuyan aglaia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. Aglaia sibuyanensis is often found in lowland to montane forests, growing in shaded, humid environments.
